intro: Chaerophyllum bulbosum, commonly known as the bulblet peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs such as parsley and dill. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features slender stems covered with fine hairs. Its small, white to greenish flowers are arranged in umbels, a characteristic common in the Apiaceae family. The plant is often found in moist, calcareous soils and can thrive in shaded or partially sunny environments.
